thread.title: Ohio officials promote fall colours for getting outdoors
thread.title_full: Ohio officials promote fall colours for getting outdoors - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Ohio officials promote fall colours for getting outdoors
text:
COLUMBUS, Ohio - Ohio national resources and tourism officials are pointing out that the arrival of autumn means there will soon be good sightseeing opportunities as forest leaves start changing colours.
Officials at the Ohio Department of Natural Resources say peak fall colours should arrive in northern Ohio by mid-October, central Ohio's fall foliage should be its most colorful in the third full week of the month, and southern Ohio peaking in late October.
TourismOhio says the strong red, bright orange and vivid yellow colours make for memorable backdrops for hiking, bike rides and other outdoor activities.
Fall foliage reports and other information is available at http://fallcolour.ohiodnr.gov
.
